body.p:
State of Kentucky
Rockcastle County Sct
To His Excellency
Govenor Bramlett.

Your Petitioner Henry Mullins would Respectfully Represent -- that at the February Term of the Rockcastle Circuit Court. he was fined. $20. for selling one quart of whisky, to one Jonathan Abney, he admits that Mr. Abney called upon him when his wife was sick in the Family way, and represented that he was bound to have the whisky. I stubornly refused him, but the circumstance of his Family at the time, still I let him have the whisky. and further states. that he has replevied the Judgment of the court. and is now nearly out, and unless relieved -- he will be compeled to pay the fine, and further states that he is a poor man, with a Family, and is unable to pay the fine and would Respectfully pray your Honor to interpose and remit the fine or so much thereof as, is due the state. and as in duty bound will ever pray &c.

State of Kentucky
Rockcastle County sct
Sworn to and Subscribed before me by Henry Mullins, the 18th day of Feby 1865

A. Smith c R c c
over
we the undersigned citizens of Mtvernon Rockcastle county Ky. state that we believe the statements made by the Petition is true, we therefore pray your Excellency, remit the fine.

Alfred. Smith C R c c
W. M. Fish Clk R Co C
F B McClary
Wm McClure

Rockcastle Cir Ct
vs
H Mullins
$20.
28th Feby/65
Remit
